synthesis.precursors: Ni, Fe, Cr, V, Mn metal salts, hydrazine as reducing agent

reaction_conditions.post_synthesis: Annealed in air, carbon template removed

XPS.peak_shift: Shift observed for Ni, Fe, Cr, V, and Mn due to oxidation states

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Nanosheet structure with uniform elemental distribution
physicochemical_characterization.EDX_maps: Homogeneous distribution of Ni, Fe, Cr, V, Mn in nanosheets

electrochemical_performance.mass_activity_A_mg: NFCVM-5 shows the highest mass activity among the series (per Figure S6e).
electrochemical_performance.stability: Stable for 500 hours at 1000 mA/cm² with no significant degradation

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: The wide variation of the d-band center in NFCVM-5 facilitates better OER performance. Mn atoms at the surface exhibit significant electronic structure modulation, contributing to enhanced OER activity. MoO4^2- adsorbs strongly to the surface, creating a protective barrier against chloride corrosion during seawater oxidation.
